intro: Convolvulus bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a climbing vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas with temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
